items.sentence: I know Tom. That's the reason why I don't trust him.
So, what do you find so interesting about dinosaurs?
Tom got drunk for the first time at that frat party.
I'm pretty sure that I speak French better than you.
You should congratulate yourself on a job well done.
I'm sorry that I was unable to write to you earlier.
Are you going to leave your jacket in the cloakroom?
Tom ate the potatoes, but he didn't eat the carrots.
I don't usually say anything at our weekly meetings.
We need to talk about what happened the other night.
Mary was the only girl at the party wearing a dress.
I'm clearly not needed here anymore, so I'm leaving.
Do you have an extra frying pan that I could borrow?
On a day like this, it's very easy to get sunburned.
You can put lipstick on a pig, but it's still a pig.
I knew there was no point in trying to convince Tom.
The first time I tried to do that, I couldn't do it.
I drank more than I should've at last night's party.
I'm sure that Tom won't be the first one to do that.
I probably won't be able to convince Tom to do that.
